intro: Brasilicereus phaeacanthus subsp. breviflorus, commonly known as the short-flowered night-blooming cactus, is a species native to Brazil. It is a member of the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and nocturnal flowering habit. The plant produces small, white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Its structure includes areoles with spines and the ability to store water in its thick stems.
